title: About Me
ideas: Hello! My name is Eduardo Osteicoechea.
I'm a Christian Thinker, BIM Architect, and Software Developer committed to professional excellence and ethics.

I obtained a Bachelor's in Architecture from the "Universidad De Los Andes" in 2017, where I practiced extensively with AutoCAD drawings and building modeling using SketchUp. I also completed a BIM training at an Autodesk Authorized Training Center called Aitec.

Between 2017 and 2018, I worked as a project assistant, modeling buildings in SketchUp and AutoCAD. Notably, I generated the exterior image, lobby interior design, and pool area design, along with their renderings in 3ds Max, for the "Lindo Sol Suites Hotel" project, and generated the exterior image, floor-plans, Sketchup 3D modeling and Rendering with VRay of the "Lindo Bakery".

My intervention on the "Lindo Sol Suites" and "Lindo Bakery", allowed my employer (Galpon5) to complete the project requirements, prescinding of the "AutoCAD Drawer", "Sketchup and AutoCAD modeler", "3Ds Max renderer", and an "Interior Designer" roles by hiring my multitasking profile.

After that, I served as a Venezuelan missionary for the "Iglesia Palabra Viva" and studied theology in the online Dominican Republic institute "Integridad & Sabidur√≠a" until 2023. Here I worked at leadership, teaching, public speaking, counseling, and begin my journey as a afficionate writer and song compositor.

During the 2020 pandemic, I decided to learn Web Development, starting with an Udemy Web Fullstack Course covering HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Bootstrap, PHP, and MySQL. I also consumed as much content as I could from Youtube channels like "Web Dev Simplified", "Kevin Powell", "Bro Code", "Programming with Mosh", and websites like "w3schools.com" and "developer.mozilla.org".
In 2023, I re-entered the AEC industry as a Revit BIM Technician for VDC Works in Miami, where I discovered visual programming through Revit Dynamo and Python Scripts.

Nonetheless, after grappling with Dynamo's limitations for a few months, I discovered RevitAPI programming with .NET and C# and embarked on the journey of developing external commands and scripts for Revit and creating Revit Plugins with WPF.

Later that year, my manager at VDC Works invited me to be the first employee of BIMIQs, a consulting startup for US AEC companies, to work as a BIM modeler, Revit's parametric families designer and modeler, Revit API developer, and Web Fullstack developer. In this role, I coded tools like the Revit Modeler and programmed and hosted the design I received for "bimiqs.com".
At BIMIQs, my employer obatiner services of BIM modeling, BIM Research, RevitAPI development and Fullstack Web Development by hiring my multitasking role.

From the last quarter of 2023 to the first of 2024, I worked as a Web Fullstack freelancer and UI & UX designer for "scalaa.com", "theinspiratagroup.com", "hotelbelensate.com", "eduardoos.com" (my previous PHP-based site), "crintt.com", and my signature landing page website "thedalessiogroup.com", where I handled the full hosting, branding, page design, and coding.

In this perior I provided freelancing services spaning through, python scripting, Website hosting setup, email migration, Fullstack development, UI & UX Design, and graphic design from a single multitasking role.

In March 2024, I started my journey as a professional BIM software developer with Avant Leap, an AI BIM Software development startup based in California. Here, I provided support and functionality extensions for Revit Add-ins such as "Clash Detection", "Object Visualizer", "Object Quantifier", "4D Simulation", Avant Leap's Revit Dynamo Zero Touch Nodes, "Mirar" "Andiamo" and "Itera" along with the full design and coding of the "SincronizadorGPS50", a desktop Windows Forms and SQL Server application to connect Gestproject2024 and Sage50.

Remarkably, during this period, I was introduced to AI integrations for applications, intervening in Andiamo Open AI Requests, Mirar queries to StabilityAI, and developing the WPF Itera Adding and collaborating on the setup of ReplicateAI-based actions.

Avant Leap received services on "Windows Applications development", "API development", "RevitAPI External Command", "Revit Adding", "Revit dynamo Zero Touch Nodes" and "AI integration" from my multitasking role.

Currently, I'm developing Fullstack web applications with React and .NET minimal APIs, GitHub CI & CD workflows for AWS EC2 instances, leveraging the DeepSeek AI API, and using SQLite, with the aim of moving towards multiplatform integrations for BIM applications for the AEC Industry.

I'm eager to continue learning and profiling my role to support AEC companies looking for multitasking professionals for AI powered BIM Multiplatform solutions, that seek to hit a sweet spot of result and cost effectiveness in a single person.
If you're interested in collaborating or hiring me, reach out through these mediums.
